Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Immunosuppressive Regimens on COVID-19 Vaccine Response in Elderly Kidney Transplant Recipients

Trial_Design.evidence: The OPTIMIZE trial, an open-label, randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: enrolled elderly KTRs (≥65 years) at the University Medical Center Groningen

Intervention.evidence: randomised to either a standard regimen of calcineurin inhibitor (CNI), mycophenolate mofetil (MMF), and prednisolone, or a regimen with low-dose CNI, everolimus, and prednisolone

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the impact of different immunosuppressive regimens on vaccine efficacy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was seroconversion rate, assessed after 2 and 3 COVID-19 mRNA vaccinations.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation was open-label, and outcome assessors were not blinded.

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 32 participants were analysed for humoral response, and 15 for cellular response.

Result_Outcome.evidence: seroconversion rates were 13% after 2 vaccinations and 38% after 3 vaccinations. In contrast, the everolimus group showed significantly higher rates of 56% (p = 0.009) and 100% (p = 0.006), respectively.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported during the study.
